change.title: Emergency and Health Services Regulation

change.changenote: Section 1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 144/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

section.marginalnote: Who will pay cost of service?
section.sectiontext: Subject to section 2, the cost of providing ambulance service to residents in the Province of British Columbia will be assumed by the commission commencing July 1, 1974 and those persons providing ambulance service authorized by the commission will be reimbursed by the commission in a manner prescribed and approved by the commission.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 191/2010, effective July 1, 2010.

section.sectiontext: The fee for a service set out in Column 1 of the Fee Schedule to this regulation is set out to the right of that service in Column 2 of the Fee Schedule.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 144/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

section.marginalnote: Commission may require contribution from others
section.sectiontext: This does not preclude the commission from requiring contribution from insurers or other agencies that may have the responsibility at present for paying for ambulance service.

section.sectiontext: For the purpose of section 6 of the Emergency and Health Services Act, the emergency medical assistant to be appointed to the board must be selected by the bargaining agent, as defined in section 1 of the Labour Relations Code, for emergency medical assistants.
